intro: Thlaspi magellanicum, commonly known as the Antarctic winter cress, is a flowering plant native to the Southern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and is part of the Brassicaceae family. This species is typically found in alpine and Antarctic environments, where it thrives in cold, harsh conditions. Thlaspi magellanicum has a low-growing habit with fleshy leaves that help it conserve moisture. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in its extreme habitats and is adapted to survive long periods of frost and limited sunlight.
